Åšramaá¹‡a Subject DÄnapÄla Respectfully Translated by Imperial Decree At that time, the lord of the gods Indra said to the assembly:
The good deeds you have done will be protected, increased, and joyfully fulfilled.
He then spoke a gÄthÄ, saying:
Having done three kinds of good, three kinds of three causes and conditions,
Three stages in sequence, three grounds, three virtues, and three great fruits;
Not killing and giving the utmost, this Dharma you love and delight in,
Attaining true patience, you will be reborn in all heavens;
Following the body, there will be a palace, and boundless bliss and pleasure will be experienced.
If a person likes evil, the place of birth will have no peace and joy,
Entangled by the increase of wrong teachings, how can one escape?
Creating this human and heavenly goodness, perfuming and cultivating within the fundamental consciousness,
When the fruits of those karmic retributions are received, one attains birth in the human and heavenly realms,
Giving rise to love and joy there, the mind abides in bliss by itself.
At that time, the lord of the gods Indra said again:
You all possess great blessings and virtues, attaining birth in the heavenly realms to experience heavenly bliss, according to the superiority or inferiority of your meritorious fruits.
If you create various kinds of blessings and virtues, perfuming your consciousness bodies, you will later be born in the heavenly realms and attain various kinds of bliss.
Thus, all the trees, flowers, and fruits delight the mind,
Entering those forests, the flying birds there expound the sounds, causing people to enjoy hearing them. For those heavenly sons, they immediately spoke this verse:
Welcome, you wise and intelligent ones, previously cultivating the highest goodness,
Firmly upholding the seven precepts, accomplishing the most supreme fruits;
Born in that celestial realm, they will experience heavenly blissful rewards.
Widely upholding the precepts, they will attain liberation from the suffering of sinking and drowning,
Because the precepts are pure, they will experience a supreme heavenly pond,
Where they can bathe at will;
And purple golden flowers will rain down and scatter upon their bodies;
And in that pond of merit, with those seeds of precepts, moment by moment preventing wrongdoing;
The supreme bliss in the heavens will be enjoyed as they wish.
If a person's mind is resolute and they guard the precepts,
When born in that celestial realm, their bliss will be boundless.
Adorned with these precepts, they will attain the fruit of the Sugata,
And experience the bliss of liberation;
The evil of breaking the precepts is as deep as a knife, fire, or poison;
Therefore, firmly uphold the precepts and cultivate the Dharma wealth of giving, and stay far away from breaking the precepts.
Karmic actions have superior, middling, and inferior, and the resulting fruits are also accordingly.
Now attaining a superior karmic body, always wearing a halo of light,
Experiencing various heavenly pleasures, with a pure and spotless body.
If a person creates evil karmic actions, the bitter fruits will entwine their body,
Transmigrating and sinking, with birth and death endless.
Since you have been reborn here, experiencing the entertainment of the heavenly multitudes,
Going out to play in the various gardens and groves, do not become attached to indulgence,
Indulgence is a deep fault, the TathÄgata always speaks of this;
Therefore, among the three poisons, indulgence is the highest.
Diligence is like sweet dew, the mind and crown are naturally cool,
Forever transcending the wheel of birth and death, reaching the ultimate shore of enlightenment.
At that time, the TathÄgata expounded subtle words,
Depart from self and quickly practice, do not become attached to inverted thoughts;
greed and other afflictions arise,
cutting off the conditions for liberation, one sinks and drowns in the ocean of suffering.
At that time, Indra, lord of the devas, quickly went to the SudharmÄ Hall. All the celestial courtesans and all the devas came to the SudharmÄ Hall.
Having arrived, they entertained themselves with various amusements.

At that time, Åšakra, lord of the devas, observed their entertainment and knew that the devas were deludedly attached to false and deceptive objects, causing their afflictions to increase. He then spoke a verse, saying:
In false and deceptive objects, craving and attachment are insatiable,
Sentient beings are deeply deluded and attached, causing their afflictions to increase;
Bound by objects, the sense faculties and consciousnesses are like poison hidden in food,
Later, when it is digested, one is confused and has no peace or joy.
There is no before, after, or in between, not this world or the next,
When the conditions and causes meet, who can avoid the karmic retribution?
At that time, Indra, Lord of the Devas, having spoken this verse, further said:
Even if one is young and strong, one cannot necessarily live long. The four characteristics push and change, quickly returning to dispersal and destruction.
The apparent happiness has no real essence. When the pleasant feelings are exhausted, the body and mind are oppressed, without temporary peace and comfort.
You should not trust in foolishness, confusion, stupidity, or flattery. If you are not content with attachment to all realms, you will later suffer greatly.
It is like a blazing fire burning grass and leaves. Attachment to realms increases faults, and it is also like this.
Being burned and cooked by the fire of afflictions, abandoning the right path, when the signs of decline appear, one falls from the heavenly realm.
Therefore, I now teach and transform you, cutting off afflictions and removing confusion;
All the heavenly beings, from here on, will always benefit the supreme practice of the Dharma. Those who are determined and cultivate will later attain tranquil supreme bliss.
You should not be arrogant and easygoing, but quickly become a good field.
In the future, you will attain the supreme reward, pleasing and inexhaustible.
If you create evil karma and various things follow your body, you will fall from the heavenly palace and sink into evil realms. All the palaces and towers will completely disappear.
At that time, the lord of the gods, Indra, saw that the heavenly beings would soon die and fall into evil realms, and spoke a verse, saying:
Fragrant lotus flowers of various colors grow on the peak,
The supreme pleasing treasures adorn everywhere.
Streams and bathing pools, trees with various colored flowers and fruits,
And purple golden kalpa trees, flocks of spiritual birds gather on top,
Always emitting subtle sounds, delighting the heavenly beings.
The immaculate lapis lazuli jewels are interspersed with golden light,
The supreme and wonderful towers and terraces are always pleasing to the mind.
Beings are never apart from them, how could they know they are illusory transformations?
Like bubbles, like foam on water, like lightning, like floating clouds,
Also like a city of fragrance, instantly scattered and destroyed.
If one falsely generates greed, one will fall into the path of samsara,
The poison of delusion and love is like fire, burning away the roots of goodness,
Diminishing the heavenly multitudes, removing all bodhi.
He further said:
If the heavens are foolish, loving people's deception, they will be subdued by the asuras, rakshasas, and others, and later fall into hell;
They will also become dragons and snakes, far from the heavens, dwelling long in the three realms, bound by ropes, and not free.

If one is free from delusion and craving, clearly penetrates and benefits sentient beings, takes refuge in the Buddha's path, forever leaves the world, cuts off the branches of existence and craving, and attains omniscience;

equally without obstruction, attains the three liberations, realizes suffering and emptiness, reaches the true ultimate reality, is far removed from cyclic existence, does not undergo subsequent existence, and is not tainted by form, smell, taste, and touch.

At that time, the Heavenly Emperor saw that many heavenly beings, moment by moment, were impermanent and increased their faults. He deeply felt compassion and spoke sincere words, uttering a verse, saying:
Thus, the heavenly path ends, sinking and drowning for a hundred thousand kalpas,
Just like a whirling fire wheel, how can birth and death ever end?
Seeing others undergo impermanence, not contemplating one's own self,
Later, when one's own life ends, the harm is also like this.
If one abandons the defiled mind and is not attached to objects,
Birth and death cannot invade, always abiding in true and tranquil bliss.
If precepts and conduct are violated, it is like drinking poisoned alcohol,
Not heavenly demons or the army of death, who can save and deliver those bound?
Fine dust covers the face, how can one's own mind know and see?
When life ends and one lies in the forest, who realizes it comes from craving and love?
If one gives rise to craving and love, dwelling together in suffering and impermanence,
Forever dwelling in birth and death, presently separated from peace and bliss;
The great evil is not completely eradicated, and samsara is obtained from this.
It is like a violent and evil wind, able to blow the leaves off the mountain peak.
One is born in the heavens due to one's own karma, and the fruits of entertainment are self-received.
Pure precepts are not foolish or deluded, and peace and bliss are self-sufficient.
Craving and foolishness lead to downfall, like fire giving rise to smoke,
Later one falls into the hells oneself, and karmic retribution is also like this.
At that time, there was a god named Upagu, whose past good karma caused him to be born in the Heaven of the Thirty-three.
There was a bhiká¹£u who was the king of the gods, and he spoke a gÄthÄ, saying:
If one creates various karmas, grasping and clinging everywhere,
By the power of the deluded mind, all karmas are accomplished.
Because the previous mind is supreme, the subsequent mind continues to arise.
Without interruption, it leads to the inexhaustible causes of the three realms;
The body of all karmic retributions cannot be attained apart from the mind.
Therefore, subdue the mind, and you will obtain inexhaustible fruits.
You should quickly diligently cultivate and subdue the mind, leaving behind grasping and delusion,
Fulfill goodness and obtain what you desire, and ultimately attain peace and joy.
If the mind is always subdued, it will never increase faults.
The wise one skillfully subdues the mind, and suffering cannot harm it.
If the mind obtains that suffering, suffering continues after suffering,
In all realms, one obtains the retribution of a light mind.
Devas, humans, asuras, dragons, ghosts, rÄká¹£asas, and so forth,
Do not depart from the one mind;
The three existences are born from one's own mind, and hell, humans, and devas,ğŸ”½Following the mind, create good and evil, wandering and drifting as one pleases.
Destroying good causes and confusing the realm, ignorance and greed are born,
Dwelling in suffering, vast and boundless, sinking and drowning, difficult to escape.
The difficult to tame mind is powerful, rushing like the wind,
The heavenly eye should not depend on form, the characteristics of consciousness are all like this.
The wise one skillfully subdues it, far from the bonds of MÄra,
Crossing over the river of birth and death, quickly reaching the other shore.
Doubtful, not upright, bottomless evil difficult to stop,
One and many subtle activities, not abiding for a moment.
The characteristics of activities are secret and difficult to fathom, without a body, present everywhere,
Who in the world pulls and leads?
Who is it that goes again?
Concealed and hidden within the Dharma, creating physical actions,
Although seeing the difference in activities and expressions, one cannot perceive the corresponding phenomena.
How is it difficult to subdue?
Formless and without characteristics, ugly and harming sentient beings, grasping objects clearly like the eye;
Although seeing the creation of good and evil, it is like an illusory person,
The inherent nature and appearance are difficult to fathom, who can perceive the going and returning?
Pulling and leading the multitude of beings, always flowing and turning in the various realms,
Sharp swords cannot cut it, fierce fires cannot burn it away;
The power of karma of all sentient beings is like this,
The rope of karma is firm, binding the multitude of beings.
The three natures are not constant, for a moment good, for a moment not good,
And also abandoning feelings together, clinging to the six sense doors.
Falsely seeking in the dust and objects, attached to the world,
Therefore, not understanding the dharma of arising and ceasing, like a mirror only reflecting in front,
And not reflecting in the back.
At that time, the celestial sons heard the bhiká¹£us speak of this matter - having previously done pure good, now obtaining a superior body - and spoke a gÄthÄ, saying:
In the past, cultivating the still and wonderful mind, carefully guarding the precepts and practices,
By means of this subtle cause, attaining to abide in the path of peace and bliss.
Those who well guard and uphold the precepts, preventing wrongdoing and giving rise to the precepts,
Will attain to sever all afflictions and realize the bliss of perfect cessation.
The precepts have great majestic virtue, able to transcend the sufferings of all existences,
Even up to the time of the end of life, there is no fear of the evil paths;
The power of precepts is the best savior.
If one upholds the precepts, all myriad virtues rely on them;
Later, one attains rebirth in the heavens, forever leaving behind all dangers and difficulties;
The Buddha, Dharma, and Saá¹…gha are the teachers, respected by all in the three realms.
At that time, the celestial sons and others prostrated with their five limbs, took refuge, made offerings, and gave rise to a respectful mind.
At that time, the lord of the devas, Åšakra, doubled his joy and delight, praised with the utmost sincerity, and spoke a verse, saying:
Liberated from the poisons of greed and hatred, a close spiritual friend to all beings,
Able to reach the other shore, I now take refuge and pay homage.
Subduing the losses of ignorance, unconditioned and unequaled,
Respected by all, I now take refuge and pay homage.
At that time, among the devas there were flying birds soaring up and down in the sky;
Or gathering at jeweled ponds, playing in the water.
There are devas who are indulgent and unrestrained, who roam and play with flying birds, indulging in sensual pleasures, not fearing the evil destinies.
At that time, the bhiká¹£us spoke a gÄthÄ for those devas, saying:
Animals indulge in sensual pleasures, playing and foolishly deluded,
The devas are also like this, equal to those flying birds.
The true teacher proclaims, 'Your minds are inverted,
Not fearing evil karma, indulging in and attached to the world.'
If devas have evil karma, they will fall into hell,
The power of karma is like this poison, the wise always stay far away.
People of little virtue and wisdom only see the pleasures of desire in front of them,
Not thinking back, they accomplish the fruits of suffering.
If there are wise people who illuminate and contemplate all evils,
Seeking to eliminate all evil karma, benefiting the multitude of beings.
Evil karma produces suffering, the supreme cause attains liberation from bondage,
Good and evil conduct are not the same, the corresponding rewards are also like this.
Deluded by suffering, mistakenly taking it as happiness, seeking comfort but never encountering it,
Endowed with wisdom, do not do evil, before long you will reach nirvana.
Skillfully cultivating all tranquil activities, skillfully accumulating wholesome roots,
SamÄdhi naturally manifests before you, quickly reaching the stage of non-arising.
Do not be attached to the animal realm, playing and frolicking in the garden,
Laziness increasing more and more, later falling into the class of flying birds.
If you have little wisdom again, not distinguishing between good and evil karma,
Hungry ghosts, asuras, and hell beings are also like this.
Those who are able to discern karma and understand its consequences,
They deeply fathom the defiled and tranquil aspects within all karmic actions,
Day and night always diligently contemplate the three emancipations,
Never falling into the hells, ultimately attaining peace and joy.
Son of Heaven, you should know that happiness and goodness are self-made,
Self-delusion gives rise to suffering, suffering and joy are not apart from the mind.
In the past, one should have avoided attachment to various defiling objects,
Indulging in the blindness of delusion, not realizing that the King of Death is urging one on,
Drowning in the hells, with suffering and distress reaching no end.
At that time, the god had hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens with excellent appearances, freely following their desires, singing and playing in the forest.
There was a flying bird that knew the god's past virtues and spoke a verse, saying:
Diligent cultivation of past wholesome karma, now reborn in the heavens,
If one engages in unwholesome causes, one will again sink into evil destinies.
Since karmic retribution is already determined, the gods are all equal,
Happiness and unhappiness, you should now know.
Attachment is the root of harm, karmic ropes bind,
Revolving without end, still relying on the power of karmic ropes.
Above to the realm of non-perception, below to the three evil paths,
Coming and going as swiftly as the wind, births as numerous as rain,
Transmigrating through the realms in a cycle, beginningless and long like this.
If the mind is tranquil, like still, clear water,
Free from obstruction like space, one attains the highest bliss.
The five consciousnesses rely on sense objects, the three evil karmas pull each other,
When one dharma is completely abandoned, one cannot be reborn in the heavens.
Killing, stealing, lust, and false speech are always evil companions,
Burning and boiling like a raging fire, the wise should observe;
True patience and kindness are the good friends of the world beyond,
If one cultivates and practices close to them, one will attain the three heavenly fruits.
Subduing and controlling deviant and chaotic thoughts, carefully guarding against greed for touch and so forth,
One will definitely be reborn in the heavens in the future, accomplishing the fruits of pure karma.
If one does not seek liberation from the karma of birth and death,
When Yama, the Lord of Death, comes, how can one escape?
At that time, the Lord of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, Indra, further said:
If there are sentient beings who are not afraid of evil, their minds are attached to everything;
Because of attachment, their wisdom is obscured.

False speech, frivolous talk, deception, flattery, disturbing sentient beings, turning their backs on the true teachings, befriending heretical teachers, being unfilial to parents, up to the interruption of wholesome roots, bound by the ropes of karma,
Like an arrow shot quickly, they die and enter hell, receiving various punishments and extreme suffering without rest.
You should all quickly abandon the causes of sin in birth and death from now on, and do not crave or cling to them again.
Carefully observe the length of your own life.
The conditioned activities are born and perish in an instant. How can they last long?
Like bubbles floating on water, like reflections in a mirror, like lightning in an instant, like clouds dispersing and disappearing.

If the blessings of the gods are exhausted, and they abandon their happy positions, all the signs of decline will appear before them without their noticing, and they will be oppressed by body and mind. How can they endure it?
Therefore, I now proclaim to you:

'You should now diligently practice with vigor, be patient and gentle, have compassion for sentient beings, guard the six sense faculties, practice the four truths, not discriminate between enemies and friends but cultivate equality, increase wisdom, deeply enter the meaning, turn away from falsehood and illuminate the truth, and guide meditation.'
When karma and afflictions are exhausted, there will be no more rebirth in the future, and one will attain liberation through both wisdom and practice.
At that time, the Lord of the Devas, Indra, wanting to reiterate this meaning, further spoke a verse, saying:
Thus, in these twelve sense bases, the six sense objects and the six sense faculties,
When consciousness and so forth arise and cease, they form in accordance with each other, becoming false imagination.
The wise one skillfully cultivates the mind, not dwelling in forms and other dharmas,
And enters the gate of tranquility, still and without a single characteristic.
Because of diligently seeking tranquility, one does not fall into the realm of MÄra,
With this still and wondrous mind, always recollecting.
If one practices such wisdom, how can delusion and suffering arise?
Within the three times, one is sovereign and fearless,
The bonds of afflictions untie themselves, and tainted defilements cannot stain;
The eye of wisdom becomes perfectly clear, always abiding in the true and tranquil practice.
The great bliss of the heavenly body is still destroyed by tainted defilements,
How is it that people are foolish and deluded, committing the ten evil deeds extensively?
If a person cultivates wisdom and understands the causes of sin and merit,
If one is afraid of karma and death invades, one will forever escape the root of suffering.
At that time, Åšakra, having heard the World-Honored One's explanation of the matters of evil destinies, then proclaimed to the heavenly multitudes:
The Buddha said:
'If a person can escape the root of sin in birth and death, always encountering good friends, planting various roots of goodness,
If reborn in the heavenly realm, experiencing wonderful happiness, with palaces and adornments, the rewards and responses are immeasurable;

If not afraid of evil paths and attached to entertainment, when the blessings and goodness are exhausted, one will certainly fall, just as a lamp must rely on oil, and when the oil is exhausted, the flame goes out.
Having fallen like this, one will be rapidly blown by the winds of karma, going back and forth in the world, revolving without stopping.
If the wise ones are rightly concentrated, the ropes of ignorance and karma cannot pull them, just like lotus fibers cannot move the wondrous high mountain.
At that time, having heard the Heavenly Emperor speak this Dharma, the god spoke a verse in praise of the Heavenly Emperor, saying:
The Dharma you have now spoken eliminates all obstructions.
I will rely on the Heavenly Emperor's words and abide in fearlessness.
For all living beings, I will be a father of compassion,
Proclaiming the city of nirvana, enabling them to attain benefit and joy.
The Dharma originally has no discrimination, and the Heavenly Emperor skillfully proclaims it.
Now encountering the true teacher, I will attain the unsurpassed path.
At that time, the Heavenly Emperor again said:
Do not give rise to greed and attachment to worldly wealth and objects.
If a person abandons wisdom and gives rise to love and attachment, it will destroy their roots of goodness;
The seven kinds of noble wealth will gradually disappear, and for hundreds of thousands of lifetimes, they will sink and drown in the evil paths.
Moreover, worldly wealth is not firm or lasting. It can be invaded and stolen by the power of water, fire, thieves, kings, and others;
If it is the wealth of the Dharma, the calamities of water, fire, and so forth cannot destroy it.
You heavenly beings, although you have power and perfect faculties, your bodies are radiant with light;
When the signs of decline appear, you will give rise to sorrow and fall into the sky below, passing through hundreds of thousands of yojanas, and enter the evil destinies.
At that time, Åšakra then spoke a verse, saying:
Just like your great happiness, wealth and nobility are immeasurable,
When the signs of decline appear, you will definitely sink into the evil destinies.
Just as you create karma in the present, you will be reborn according to the fruits of karma,
The characteristics of karma are supremely excellent, and the fruits of retribution are also like that.
Karma has upper, middle, and lower levels, and the categories of good and evil are the same,
When they attain their karmic retribution, the superior and inferior are also like this.
You should carefully contemplate, the most supreme body with form and strength,
Yet unable to escape birth and death, how can you not fall?
It is like wheat and other seeds, burned by a great fire,
Burned and destroyed, how can sprouts grow?
The floating and false body, the four characteristics change and flow quickly,
Like a lamp giving off flames, not abiding for a moment.
The characteristics of the mind are also like this, illusory and without reality,
Constantly being increased by outflows, how can one attain peace and joy?
Abandon the false objects, do not love your body,
Definitely escape the cycle of rebirth, quickly reach the other shore.
At that time, there was a flying bird among the gods who spoke again, saying:

We now dwell in the Utpala Grove. In that grove there is a large bathing pond, with many red lotuses blooming for a long time, exuding fragrance. The birds' bodies and wings are variegated in color, resembling the seven treasures;
Their eyes have light, and their voices are wonderful. We play and enjoy ourselves in that grove for a long time.
The Heaven of Observation, being addicted and deluded, then spoke a verse, saying:
I always indulge in pleasures, and the gods and humans love it too.
Although the gods are different from birds, their love and defilement are no different.
If one cannot uphold and practice the Dharma, how can one attain liberation?
If the gods are like this, what is the difference from flying birds?
Now I tell you again, do not be attached to the pleasures of the five desires,
But cultivate the practice of supreme Dharma, and you will attain great liberation.
The sufferings of birth, old age, sickness, and death will never harm your body.
The birds and the gods' bodies are equal, and they attain good benefits.
At that time, the Heavenly Emperor again said:
If there are wise ones who are free from defilements and are pure, worldly sinful stains will not be able to attach to these gods.
Why is it so?
It is because those wise ones understand the causes and conditions of birth and suffering;
and they do not cling to friends, acquaintances, loved ones, and relatives in the heavens.
You gods are foolish, greedy, and not free from cyclic existence, no different from those flying birds.
Moreover, there are sentient beings who are addicted to drinking alcohol, and their offenses are very grave.
Why is it so?
It is because those sentient beings' minds are confused and deluded, and they often break the precepts;

Although the power of alcohol is gone, the karmic retribution is not extinguished. In the five destinies, one cycles and does not cease. Among all offenses, it is the most serious. Even up to koá¹­is of kalpas, one drifts and does not cease, sinking and drowning in evil destinies, bound by afflictions - as the Buddha has said.
At that time, in the garden of that Heavenly King Åšakra, there was a wonderful Dharma hall, adorned with various precious treasures.
The heavenly multitudes went to that hall.
At that time, Åšakra, observing the heavenly multitudes, spoke a verse, saying:
You heavenly multitudes, having cultivated subtle goodness in the past,
Attained birth in the heavenly realms;
If the heavenly retribution is exhausted, one will definitely fall into the cycle of rebirth.
Pulling and leading sentient beings, in the three realms and five destinies,
Born in various places.
Carefully and subtly contemplating, birth and cessation are momentary,
Why do you not realize and awaken?
Relying on the various precepts, firmly establishing the seven factors of awakening,
Diligent in practicing the eightfold noble path, well abiding in the five faculties,
Increasing the five powers, the four establishments of mindfulness and right efforts,
And the four bases of supernatural power;
